stk.molecular.topologies.macrocycle module¶

Defines macrocycle topologies.

class stk.molecular.topologies.macrocycle.Cyclic(repeating_unit, orientation, n)¶

Bases: stk.molecular.topologies.base.Topology

Represents cyclic polymers forming a macrocycle.

repeating_unit¶

A string showing the repeating unit of the Cyclic. For example, "AB" or "ABB". The building block with index 0 in MacroMolecule.building_blocks is labelled as "A" while index 1 as "B" and so on.

Type:str
orientation¶

For each character in the repeating unit, a value between 0 and 1 (both inclusive) must be given in a list. It indicates the probability that each monomer will have its orientation along the chain flipped. If 0 then the monomer is guaranteed to not flip. If 1 it is guaranteed to flip. This allows the user to create head-to-head or head-to-tail chains, as well as chain with a preference for head-to-head or head-to-tail if a number between 0 and 1 is chosen.

Type:tuple of float
n¶

The number of repeating units which in the macrocycle.

Type:int
__init__(repeating_unit, orientation, n)¶

Initialize a Cyclic instance.

Parameters:
  • repeating_unit (str) – A string showing the repeating unit of the Cyclic. For example, "AB" or "ABB". The building block with index 0 in MacroMolecule.building_blocks is labelled as "A" while index 1 as "B" and so on.
  • orientation (tuple of float) – For each character in the repeating unit, a value between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (inclusive) must be given. The values give the probability that each monomer is flipped by 180 degrees when being added to the chain. If 0 then the monomer is guaranteed to not flip. If 1 it is guaranteed to flip. This allows the user to create head-to-head or head-to-tail chains, as well as chain with a preference for head-to-head or head-to-tail if a number between 0 and 1 is chosen.
  • n (int) – The number of repeating units which are used to make the macrocycle.
bonded_fgs(macro_mol)¶

Yield functional groups to react.

Parameters:macro_mol (Macrocycle) – The polymer being assembled.
Yields:tuple of int – Holds the ids of the functional groups set to react.
build(macro_mol, bb_conformers=None)¶

Assembles rdkit instances of macromolecules.

This method places an rdkit molecule of the assembled macromolecule into the mol attribute of MacroMolecule. It also creates the MacroMolecule.bb_counter and MacroMolecule.bonds_made attributes.

Parameters:
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The MacroMolecule instance which needs to be built.
  • bb_conformers (list of int, optional) – The ids of the building block conformers to be used. Must be equal in length to building_blocks and orders must correspond. If None, then -1 is used for all building blocks.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
cleanup(macro_mol)¶

Performs final clean up actions on an assembled molecule.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
place_mols(macro_mol)¶

Place monomers on a large circle.

The monomers are placed around a large circle centred at the origin, so that the vector running between the functional groups is placed in a direction tangent to the circle.

Parameters:macro_mol (Macrocycle) – The macrocycle being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
prepare(macro_mol)¶

Performs ops between placing and reacting building blocks.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
